arts.ttl: Arne Slot names the one player who cost Liverpool victory at Crystal Palace as he blames ¬£30m star for stoppage-time winner
arts.sum: Eddie Nketiah's added-time winner brought the Reds crashing down to earth after five straight wins and ensured Crystal Palace are now the only unbeaten team in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Nketiah stoppage-time Palace winner subjects Liverpool to first league defeat
arts.sum: Eddie Nketiah strikes with virtually the last kick of an enthralling encounter at Selhurst Park to give Crystal Palace a deserved victory and end Premier League leaders Liverpool's five-match winning start to the season.

arts.ttl: Hits and misses: Wirtz wilts again - but Doku dominates for Man City
arts.sum: Jeremy Doku now has three assists in his last three Premier League games for Manchester City, more than he had managed in his previous 17 appearances in the competition. Following Brighton's 3-1 win at Stamford Bridge over Chelsea, Seagulls head coach Fabian Hurzeler discusses the club's transfer history with the Blues after they've sold players and staff to the West Londoners.

arts.ttl: 'Was of no use': Arne Slot points the finger at ¬£34m Liverpool star over Crystal Palace's late winner

arts.ttl: Glasner's pulsating Palace brutally expose Liverpool flaws
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner's thrilling Crystal Palace side are on the march as they brutally expose Liverpool's weaknesses, says chief football writer Phil McNulty

arts.ttl: Arne Slot publicly calls out one Liverpool player for error which led to Crystal Palace winner
arts.sum: Liverpool surrendered their perfect start in the Premier League as Eddie Nketiah scored a dramatic 97th-minute winner for Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park on Saturday

arts.ttl: Liverpool players ratings vs Crystal Palace as Alexander Isak and Mohamed Salah both struggle
arts.sum: Ian Doyle's Liverpool player ratings after Arne Slot's side were beaten 2-1 by Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park in the Premier League

arts.ttl: Eddie the Eagle! Palace turn tables on Liverpool in exhilarating late win
arts.sum: Liverpool's perfect start to the 2025-26 Premier League season comes to an end in the most extraordinary circumstances as Crystal Palace leave it incredibly late to triumph 2-1 over the Reds at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace 2-1 Liverpool: Eddie Nketiah nets 97th-minute winner to inflict first defeat of the season on Premier League champions as Eagles extend unbeaten run to 18 MATCHES
arts.sum: DOMINIC KING: Try as they might, the Selhurst Park stewards were fighting a losing battle. Though they asked the locals to start heading for the exits, nobody was listening
